comment: Great class and great professor! Easy class too! VERY short lectures which is nice. Weekly homework is answering questions in textbook and a quiz. 2 open book exams which are easy too. Really great class. Highly would recommend. Apply yourself a little and you will do well and learn medical terms very very well. TAKE HER CLASS!
Very easy class. She is straightforward and I can appreciate that. Quiz and chapter homework due every week. Only 2 exams.

This class would have been much easier if it was not a maymester. Time managment is key. If you study 8-10 hours per daily assesment you will have no problem making an A. It all boils down to putting the necessary time in. Esmat is amazing and will respond very quickly to any questions or concerns. Shes super helpful and wants students to succeed
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Test heavy

comment: Dr. Esmat is one of the best professors I've taken at KSU. She genuinely cares about your success and will help you as much as she can. If I could take all my classes with her I would. Tests aren't easy but if you go to lectures and know what you're talking about you'll be okay.

Dr. Esmat is extremely professional and super helpful! She is nice but very fair. I had her for senior seminar - 5 quizzes (2 take home), 1 final, and 1 project (easy professional preparation), 1 final. Attendance some days count towards grade!. She tends to overemphasize the need to come to class but all ES professors are like that for some reason

This lady is so freaking amazing. I had her for Senior Seminar. I will tell you, a lot of work to be done BUT she reminds you every day. I was not prepared for life after graduation until I met her. Wish I had her for other classes!

Best teacher I've ever had! She really knows her stuff and it shows in her teaching.  She puts PPTs online and leaves blanks on there to fill in during class. I highly suggest this and just take side notes in class. I took her for Ex. Phys 1 and  Aging.  Book is not required but I recommend it for a better understanding of the material.

Dr. Esmat is honestly one of the best professors I've had at KSU. If you have the opportunity to take her, you should! She makes the material easy to understand. I'm taking her again for another class over the summer
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Amazing lectures--Caring

comment: -Maymester is crazy in itself, but she made it so much bearable.  -She's super clear cut, gives you her expectations and expects you to meet her there. -Love the way she portrays herself, is funny, kind, and helpful  when you have questions. -Treat her the way you want to be treated, is super knowledgeable, and is a fantastic professor.

She is a very professional person. Be sure to be as specific as possible when approaching her about lecture or an assignment. Overall she doesn't trick you; She wants you to succeed. You can learn a lot from this teacher. I would take her over half of the professors in the ES major. 8 quizzes that aren't difficult and service learningcase studies.

Dr. Esmat is wonderful! She teaches in a way that makes the material very comprehensible but you still have to study a little. She'll help you out, but you must reach out to her. She is very professional, yet still one of my favorites in the department!
Very good professor.  Expect the class to be hard, because the material is hard.  Study and study a LOT.  She is very helpful if you go to her, but she doesn't hold your hand.

I love the way she teaches her class. She does reviews in class ALL the time. Attendance is not Mandatory but I strongly recommend it. Going to class is very helpful. If you go to class and do the work that is asked of you it is easy to make a good grade. She has a good sense of humor, and will do anything to help you. She is great!!
Good professor, must go to class. Stern but fair.
